noun.description: A place that is a popular destination for vacations or recreation, or which is frequented for a particular purpose.
The action of turning to and adopting a strategy or course of action, especially a disagreeable or undesirable one, so as to resolve a difficult situation.
examples: territorial questions must not be settled by resort to violence

verb.description: Turn to and adopt (a strategy or course of action, especially a disagreeable or undesirable one) so as to resolve a difficult situation.
examples: the duke was prepared to resort to force if negotiation failed

verb.description: Go often or in large numbers to.
examples: local authorities have a duty to provide adequate sites for gypsies “residing in or resorting to” their areas

origin: Late Middle English (denoting something one can turn to for assistance): from Old French resortir, from re- again + sortir come or go out. The sense place frequently visited dates from the mid 18th century.
